title.narrative: OUTPUT 1: EVIDENCE-BASED POLICIES, PLANS AND BUDGETS FOR EDUCATION AND SKILLS

description.narrative: By 2022, Education departments and institutions are strengthened at all levels to develop evidence-based policies, plans and budgets for equitable and relevant early learning and basic education with focus on learning and skills development.

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)

Pakistan Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Education)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, Education departments and institutions are strengthened at all levels to develop evidence-based policies, plans and budgets for equitable and relevant early learning and basic education with focus on learning and skills development.

description.narrative: Education sector plans were endorsed in Punjab and Sindh, and sector analysis completed in Balochistan. The Federal Government decided provincial allocations from the increased US$ 125 million country allocation from the Global Platform for Education, with UNICEF and DFID support. Policy and systems support focused on early childhood education, non-formal education and education management information systems in different provinces and instituting the delivery approach for evidence-based planning, financial allocations and sector monitoring in Gilgit-Baltistan. UNICEF technical assistance together with the European Union's €42 million education sector budget support is enabling policy and systems reforms in Sindh. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Innovations - Availability of strong evidence of successful and cost-effective innovations to improve access and learning for the most disadvantaged children - score (1-4), see guidance
Existence of an effective early learning policy with clear budget allocation in place
Existence of provincial education strategy/plan that promote equity in terms of access and learning

baseline.value: No, 4 provincial plans to be reviewed

actual.value: 2019:PBESP endorsed BESP in process, ESA completed. SESP endorsed KPESP process initiated
